org.lenskit.eval.crossfold

Class Crossfolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lenskit.eval.crossfold.Crossfolder

  • public class Crossfolder
extends Object

    The command to build and run a crossfold on the data source file and output the partition files

      • setIsolate

        public Crossfolder setIsolate(boolean on)

        Configure whether the train-test data sets generated by this task will be isolated. If yes, then each data set will be in its own isolation group; otherwise, they will all be in the default isolation group (the all-zero UUID).

        Parameters:
        on - true to produce isolated data sets.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining).

      • getIsolate

        public boolean getIsolate()

        Query whether this task will produce isolated data sets.

        Returns:
        true if this task will produce isolated data sets.

      • setWriteTimestamps

        public Crossfolder setWriteTimestamps(boolean pack)

        Configure whether to include timestamps in the output file.

        Parameters:
        pack - true to include timestamps (the default), false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining).

      • getWriteTimestamps

        public boolean getWriteTimestamps()

        Query whether timestamps will be written.

        Returns:
        true if output will include timestamps.

      • getName

        public String getName()

        Get the visible name of this crossfold split.

        Returns:
        The name of the crossfold split.

      • setName

        public Crossfolder setName(String n)

        Set a name for this crossfolder. It will be used to generate the names of individual data sets, for example.

        Parameters:
        n - The crossfolder name.
        Returns:
        The crossfolder (for chaining).

      • getSource

        public DataSource getSource()

        Get the data source backing this crossfold manager.

        Returns:
        The underlying data source.

      • setSkipIfUpToDate

        public Crossfolder setSkipIfUpToDate(boolean skip)

        Set whether the crossfolder should skip if all files are up to date. The default is to always re-crossfold, even if the files are up to date.

        Parameters:
        skip - true to skip crossfolding if files are up to date.
        Returns:
        The crossfolder (for chaining).

      • getSkipIfUpToDate

        public boolean getSkipIfUpToDate()

      • execute

        public void execute()

        Run the crossfold command. Write the partition files to the disk by reading in the source file.

      • getDataSets

        public List<DataSet> getDataSets()

        Get the train-test splits as data sets.

        Returns:
        The data sets produced by this crossfolder.
